title: Wrong contact when grasping cylinder primitive (Gazebo4)

content.raw:
With Gazebo4, I'm getting the following when grasping a scaled cylinder primitive (The cylinder is added to the Gazebo world via the toolbar and then scaled). Everything looks good, with the exception of the "weird" contact that is shown at the lower end of the cylinder in the screenshot. It does not break the grasp, but is obviously wrong. Given that the grasp works, this might only be a contact visualization issue (?).

I haven't checked this with a newer Gazebo version yet, so if the issue has already been fixed feel free to close this one.
![contact_issue.jpg](data/bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/2278744131-contact_issue.jpg)

The hand geometry used can be found [here](https://github.com/hector-humanoid/thor_vt_hand_common/tree/master/thor_vt_hand_description) and I can provide instruction for reproducing the full setup if that turns out to be useful.  The hand uses a ~200 poly mesh for the palm and primitives for the fingers. As the fingers have only one contact allowed and the palm has 6 allowed contacts, I assume the visualized wrong contact is between palm (mesh) and cylinder.

The hand geometry used can be found here and I can provide instruction for reproducing the full setup if that turns out to be useful. The hand uses a ~200 poly mesh for the palm and primitives for the fingers. As the fingers have only one contact allowed and the palm has 6 allowed contacts, I assume the visualized wrong contact is between palm (mesh) and cylinder.
